extendedIngredients.name: american cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 ounces sliced Colby or American cheese

extendedIngredients.name: mushroom
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 can (4 ounces) mushroom stems and pieces, drained and liquid reserved

extendedIngredients.name: stuffing mix
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 package (8 ounces) herb seasoning stuffing mix

recipes.title: Chicken and Stuffing Pie

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken on the menu? Try pairing with Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. One wine you could try is CalNaturale Chardonnay Lodi. It has 4.1 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 11 dollars.

productMatches.title: CalNaturale Chardonnay Lodi
productMatches.description: Complexity and intensity define this Chardonnay. The nose is full of citrus, green apple and pear with floral overtones. The flavors are rich on entry with lively fruit in the mid palate and a long fruity, warm finish.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a small bowl, combine crust ingredients; press into a greased 10-in. pie plate and set aside. In a small bowl, combine flour and mushroom liquid until smooth; set aside.                                                                                            In a large saucepan, saute mushrooms and onion in butter. Stir in all remaining ingredients except cheese. Heat through; pour into stuffing crust.                                                                                            Bake, uncovered, at 375° for 20 minutes. Cut cheese slices into strips; arrange in a lattice design on pie. Bake 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted.                                        Yield: 6-8 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Chicken and Stuffing Pie in  Country WomanJanuary/February 1988, p29                                                                                                                            Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a small bowl, combine crust ingredients; press into a greased 10-in. pie plate and set aside. In a small bowl, combine flour and mushroom liquid until smooth; set aside.
In a large saucepan, saute mushrooms and onion in butter. Stir in all remaining ingredients except cheese.
Heat through; pour into stuffing crust.
Cut cheese slices into strips; arrange in a lattice design on pie.
Bake 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted.
